name: Alfred Maynard
text: Excellent food at affordable prices on the lunch menu (note: I have only eaten at Sushi Yama for Sunday lunches).  They have excellent steak hibachi that both my wife and I enjoy.  Also, the food is served very quickly, so you can eat and get on with they rest of your day.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Eleshia Lusane
text: I've eaten at Sushi Yama a number of times and I love the yummy yummy roll. My sister doesn't like sushi but even she had to admit that deep-fried sushi is great. The service is always good and prices are very reasonable.

name: Whitney Prince
text: We were in town for the weekend and tried this place out for sushi. It was very good! I recommend the fire Dragon roll, fried calamari and egg rolls. Ingredients are fresh and the service is good.

name: Abby R
text:
Great sushi, great prices.  Very courteous staff
The Golden California roll is awesome!
We always get the Angry wife roll, crazy roll.
Both are fried rolls and delicious.

name: Gina Teeter
text: We love this place great food,  super nice service from the time you walk in til you leave.   Great family times here and many more to come.

name: Alexis Ikner
text: The food was pretty good but the woman server was horrible she has a smart mouth and she touch my straw with her hands and plus she's a server and doesn't know anything. I would go again but I don't recommend the woman server.

name: Brad Seehawer
text:
Located in what looks like the husk of a Rainforest Cafe, Sushi Yama was as busy as you would expect for a Sunday Montgomery dinnertime, and though the conspiracy theory part of my mind had suspicions they were separating the Asian and non-Asian sections of the restaurant, hey - at least they thought Sushi Yama was up to snuff. Encouraging.

The house special had ten pieces of sashimi, an equal number of sushi, and a Super Crunch Shrimp Roll. I had no issues with the cut of the fish, though the rice was a little hard and disconcerting. Also, the dish cost $44, and while I understand that apparently good fish costs quite a bit around here, I don't know if I would really consider it good enough to drop a Ulysses S. Grant on it here.

name: Brandon Scott
text: ROACH!!! My girlfriend and I went to have dinner and a roach come across our table. The management didn't ask us if we were ok or anything. Then the waitress didn't come back till it was time to pay.

name: UnbiasedReport
text: Thank you so much for the great time! We came here last week and really liked the atmosphere. The owner was really really nice and friendly. They seem to be appreciative of the patrons. We really love the food! It was such a wonderful experience having never been to Korea to actually experience it in the dishes. I really felt like they put a lot of hard work into preparing the dishes. The owner also offered us some freshly picked tomatoes and they were good! I also really enjoyed the kimchi cucumbers as a great mix with the bibimbap. My husband and I had a good time and can't say enough that it was a wonderful experience!

name: Robin Wilkie
text: We like to drive around and see what opportunities are available for dinner, spontaneous is fun! This place was just too awesome for words! Under $50 for 2 is pretty remarkable, especially since the food here is a definite 10. Hot stone plate with short ribs and the beef stir fry was our choices. Damn they were  so good. Definitely headed back when we return to get stuffed!

name: Suzie Jo
text: We ate their Korean BBQ. It was delicious, and we had a super fun time. Will be coming back. :)

name: C GH
text:
Whenever we are driving East via Montgomery, we stop here. Teen Mini-me loves their food. The menu has slightly changed since our last visit--she didn't order her fave, she ordered the chicken fried rice. It was DELICIOUS. The chicken and diced vegetables tasted freshly prepared with smoky grilled undertones.
My bulgogi was tender and flavorful. A server (actually I think she may have been the Mgr, maybe owner) welcomed us and brought out several small dishes before we ordered. She said the kimchee is her mother's recipe. If we were spending the night,  I would have ordered an adult beverage to round out the meal. Alas, I was driving, and a distance at that.
The restaurant observes protocol and provides masks and sanitizers upon entry (but we had our own. )
The only discord was the sushi chef (who was out front neither acknowledged our entry, responded to us greeting him, nor called for someone to assist us. It was several minutes (in fact were turning to leave) before someone came out.

name: ERIC CULPEPPER
text: My new fav place for Korean food! Everything was delicious. Those sweet potato noodles were everyone’s favorite. Bimbpop was outstanding! They let me make the rice extra crunchy by putting the pan on the table top stove. Service was fantastic.

name: Keri Maffei
text: It was a wonderful experience!  All the wait staff were super attentive and helpful!  Soo many items to choose from on the menu and the food was outstanding!  Very nice quiet dining rooms available.  Clean restaurant and restrooms.

name: Richard Jr. Mullins
text: Excellent all the way around!!  They receive fresh uni every Friday.  Uni is extremely hard to find around here and I absolutely love the stuff.  All the rest of their sushi is top notch, as well.

name: Jeremy Warnken
text: Great atmosphere and good food. They have private dining rooms for small groups

name: Nury Quintero
text: I love going here. The food is great! Not only that, the staff are kind and wonderful

name: Lisle and Jessica Babcock
text: Great staff, amazing food, and outstanding prices.  This will become a staple restaurant for our family.  Really enjoyed our visit.

name: Locost GT
text: I have eaten Korean BBQ in many cities around the country. The food and service I received here was on par, but with better sides than what I have received elsewhere. However the beauty of Keum Kang San was that the price and overall value was better than what I have received at other Korean BBQ establishments. I will definitely be going again!

name: Jurjen Smies
text: This appears to be a newish restaurant in a location that's housed others before, and the operators still seem a little uncertain about how the food will be received by the non-Korean clientele (particularly since they don't have non-Korean dishes on the menu). Speaking for my girlfriend and myself, who sampled a good few Korean places in Washington state before moving here, we were very satisfied indeed: we had the Korean sausage hot pot (which also contains other meats, like I think beef tongue) and it was utterly delicious, as were the ban chan that came with it. We were very happy to have stumbled across this establishment and will definitely be back.

name: Rachael Sandhagen-Turner
text: This is some of the most delicious food I have ever had. The service is excellent, too. Such a wonderful variety.

name: Paul
text: This is really an underrated Korean restaurant. I've been to famous Korean BBQ restaurants in Atlanta, Seattle and even LA, and this place, though pricey, offers one of the tastiest, top-quality Korean BBQ experience. Their Korean army base stew (boodae jjigae) is also the best. If you are looking for a good Korean cuisine for your family and friends, give this place a try and check it out for yourself.

I'm not so sure if they are catering dine-in customers at the moment too.. It's a bit pricey, but we will be coming back here for sure.

and stir fried squid over rice. I would recommend you to try their chicken! It's SO GOOD!

text: Excellent Korean Fried Chicken and kimbap.

name: Priscilla Udomprasert
text: The cashier was extremely nice. The wait time was fast. I was resisting the urge to start eating while driving because it smelled so good. For the price, you get so much. Not only does it taste good, it's also delicious. Definitely recommend!

name: Mae Shinigami
text: Sweet owner lady & AWESOME kimbap/sushi. Spicy tuna was actually spicy & had egg, carrot, pickled radish & imitation crab. So tasty! Stopped on a whim, so def will be back for the kfc.

name: 大西ミシェル
text:
Best Korean chicken I’ve had in a while. 💯  obsessed with the sweet sauce chicken! I don’t have to travel to Atlanta! They’re even better than Bon Chon (which had been my favorite) and that says a lot.

Please don’t ever close down. 😻

name: Jenny Mizell
text: If you love good fried chicken this is the place. Had the sweet and spice and the green onion chicken. It was just the best. The lady that own this place is so sweet and kind.  It is a must try.

name: A. M. D. Vaughan
text: Very friendly "seasoned" cashier. I was immediately put at ease. We had the wings: half plain, half spicy sauced and the beef bulgogi bowl. Wings were DELICIOUS, I'm ready to go back to order more, all spicy sauced this time. The bowl was okay, beef not over-tenderized, subtle garlic flavor...could use a little lite sauce for the 🍚. Nevertheless, we will def. be back... May try pork bulgogi next time.

name: Bryndon Howell
text: Visited the restaurant for the first time with really high hopes. Shortly after seating, there was a loud slam from upstairs. Soy sauce began to pour on my shirt and arm. I went to tell the servers up front and they didn’t seem to care too much. I believe it was the owner who told me that it’s just soy sauce, but she didn’t apologize… in fact, business carried on as usual after they cleaned it. We only got an apology after we were headed towards the door… I understand accidents happen, and I have no problem with soy sauce on my shirt, but the lack of consideration made me lose my appetite. The food looked delicious though, and I would’ve loved to try it… I may try them again one day in the future, wearing a poncho.

name: Natalia Dobrowolski
text: We visited for the first time today and it was a wonderful experience! It took us a few minutes to realize that you have to pass the call buttons attached to the tables when your want to order but after we figured that out it was all smooth sailing. The staff was fantastic and the food was amazing. Everyone had a great time and we will definitely be recommending it to our friends.

name: Claudette Hendrix
text: Since I found this place I have been here twice, I loved the fried rice, all the flavors and fried chicken. Can't wait to get back

resp.text: Thank you and see you soon 😊

name: ken evola
text: I was blown away by the generous portions and how delicious the food was here.  The drinks from cheetos was the icing on the cake! Definitely recommend them to all!!

name: Dylan Akers
text:
Absolutely divine. Authentic Korean food with a crazy diverse menu and pretty solid prices.

I recommend going for lunch and getting the Spicy ChickChick (Lunch #1). Very solid meal with a lot of food for about $10.

Would definitely recommend to any locals in the area that haven't tried it yet

name: Claudette Hendrix
text: First visit won't be my last. I loved the flavor in my stir fry chicken and rice.

name: 오민환
text: Clean and fancy restaurant, but the yang nyeom chicken wasn't the one what I expected

name: Wayne
text:
Cozy, friendly atmosphere.
Food is hot, very good, and fresh. It's like if you took your girlfriend to meet your parents for the first time, and your mom was so happy to meet her, she immediately begin making y'all a hot meal. Worth the wait.

My wife had Teriyaki Chick-Chick, and I had the Spicy Chick-Chick. The food took a bit (10 to 15 min) for them to prepare. But I feel it was because they made it per order. It was definitely not cooked hours before and left sitting around on heaters like some places do.

Our food bowls came with Kimchi and dumplings. Both yummy.

Overall, Really enjoyed. Will be back.

resp.text: Thank you for a five star review. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Qing Chang
text:
As a Korean restaurant, the waiter said they don't have steamed rice? So I have to eat the spicy fried intestines alone. Finally got diarrhea when I back to home.
As for the service, the waiter looks really unprofessional, even though they have a ring on each table, they still very impatient. Everytime I ask something to them I feel really nervous. Waited about 1 hour to get my hotpot ready.
I love korean food but I just don't like the way they did.

resp.text: I'm sorry about how my servers treated you. Maybe if there is next time at at my restaurant  just let me know and I will make sure service you deserve as my customer and I'm sorry again.

Long waiting period, over 30 mins and not fresh foods, just defrosted frozen food and old steamed rice...! Terrible service ever seen!
Unbelievable!!

resp.text: Before you post what you're experienced have you talk to owner or anybody in charge? Seems you came in to make complaints. 30 min? Frozen food and rice? Everything is made to order don't make story out of it .if you have a problem let me know I can refund what you have ordered today.

name: Sherry Jenkins
text: This was so delicious. I will for sure be back again. The staff was very friendly and the food excellent!

name: First Person Atheist
text: This place is awesome for a date. My wife and I had so much fun. I won't lie, the service side is still being built but it is obvious that all of them are putting the entirety of themselves into this restaurant. There is a good bit of a wait but it is completely worth it. If you're looking for the standard applebees experience then go to applebees. If you want amazing, authentic, Korean cuisine then chickchick porkpork grill is where you want to be. The food was excellent, the owner cares about your experience and it's a lot of fun seeing the staff run around trying to make everything happen. If you want to skip all of that you can order from them through door dash or uber eats, you should, it's very tasty. This is our new favorite place, keep up the hard work!

resp.text: Thank you and we are trying to serve our customers better 😀

name: Mark Bradley
text: Been a lot of years since I was in Korea but this tastes just like I remember.

name: Lauren Ledbetter
text: These wings are the best, honey garlic parmesean! I do wish the Bento box would've had dumpling sauce instead of soy sauce though.

resp.text: Thank you 😊 We hope to see you again very soon.

text: Okay listen. This is the best place to go to for authentic Korean food. The atmosphere is really welcoming and the food is always delicious. I recommend the Honey Butter chicken, spicy Dak Gang Jeong, and beef bulgogi if you have never been here before. Excellent service and a wonderful experience every time.

name: Rosezana Gill
text: I was really looking forward to eating here because of the high ratings. The food was okay, not much flavor and somewhat bland. The teriyaki chicken had no teriyaki flavor at all. I was thinking that at least the kimchi would be good but it was all so spicy that it was inedible. The soy sauce was in the center of the plate and could not be poured so we asked for a container of it and we were given 2 small packets (for a party of 3). I’m only rating so that others know before going that it’s definitely not a 5 star restaurant.

After waiting for 40 min+ with water and pretzel only, saw someone cooking my food right next to me. Not even in the kitchen. Why couldnt they have done that as soon as I ordered.

text: The sweetest people, and great food. Accommodating in explaining the menu to newbies, but are just as happy to let you go it on your own. The Honey Peanut Dak Gang Jeong tastes like chicken and waffles.

resp.text: Thank you very much! We hope to see you again soon.

text: If I could give it more than 5 stars then I would! The food was so fresh and tasty! The atmosphere was amazing, as well as, the staff being very welcoming and friendly. Definitely going back again!

text: My boyfriend and I had dinner last night and it was great! We tried the Fried Dumplings and  Dak Gang Jeong (marinated fried boneless chicken, fry tube rice cakes and peppers). The filling in the fried dumplings was rich and flavorful. The Dak Gang Jeong was lightly fried served in a spicy sauce with traditional Korean banchan. The owner and staff are extremely friendly and appreciative of the business! We can't wait to go back to try more!

name: Ryan Marshmam
text: The Korea House restaurant is a nice get away from the fast life. The 4 different types of kimchi were pretty good. I loved the cucumber and the cabbage the best. The other 2 will definitely have to grow on me. I got the Korean short rib meal and my son got the chicken. He loved his meal as did I. They are open for dine in, but they put everything in to go boxes. The fried Mandu was super good. I got the meat instead of the vegetable choice... Amazing please try this restaurant out, it's very inexpensive.

name: Chef
text: I have only had Korean once before but this is way better than what I remember. The presentation was very clean (even though it was to go) and the service was very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this to any one for new flavors and fantastic food!

name: JT Fellows
text: An unassuming hidden gem in Columbus. I’ll definitely be coming back.

name: A C
text: This is one of my favorite places. My kids love it too. We order two meals for the three of us to share and still leave with a plate full of leftovers.

name: Dom Lasha
text: I've just had my third visit. The food is consistently delicious. They have the best Ramen in town!!!! I like to eat in on my lunch break. Seating is grouped, so bring family or friends if you don't want to sit at a large table alone. Prices can add up quickly so be mindful of what you order if you're on a budget. Parking is tight so be aware. Last, please do not expect to walk into a five-star, brightly lit, resort style restaurant. The Korea House is a homey, comfortable break from the realities of the outside. Enjoy your meal!

name: Robert Larson
text: I have drove past this place more times than I can count and today was my first time ever eating here. This place is awesome. It has a cozy atmosphere and the staff is extremely friendly. This food is delicious and the service is really fast. I recommend coming to this place if you like Korean food. I will be coming back!

name: Cathryn W
text: The service is fantastic and so is the food. I definitely recommend the chicken ramen and steamed mandu.

name: Marty Upshaw
text: My office is within walking distance to the restaurant.  I'll usually eat here once every two or three weeks.  The spicy pork lunch plate is a great deal in my opinion. Grab their restaurant card and get it stamped so that after 9 orders, you'll get a free appetizer.  Great food all around!  I have never been disappointed with their food - it really is awesome!

name: Ari Harris
text: Always amazing! Super sweet people there! Fantastic food!

name: Shatoria Lunsford
text: Stopped by on a whim coming from Marietta, brought me back to Koreatown in Chicago. Will definitely be back!

name: Kirah Watson
text: Loveeeee their food! Best Korean food in Columbus hands down.

name: Dom Lasha
text: I've just had my third visit. The food is consistently delicious. They have the best Ramen in town!!!! I like to eat in on my lunch break. Seating is grouped, so bring family or friends if you don't want to sit at a large table alone. Prices can add up quickly so be mindful of what you order if you're on a budget. Parking is tight so be aware. Last, please do not expect to walk into a five-star, brightly lit, resort style restaurant. The Korea House is a homey, comfortable break from the realities of the outside. Enjoy your meal!

name: Salima Gowani
text: Although i did not think I would eat anything I went in with my husband, but the sides and the salad they serve were absolutely amazing. I would go again just because my server was very understanding and helpful finding me. Vegeterian meal and the food was spot on.

name: Marty Upshaw
text: My office is within walking distance to the restaurant.  I'll usually eat here once every two or three weeks.  The spicy pork lunch plate is a great deal in my opinion. name: Alyssa Moody
text: So much delicious food at a great price. I highly recommend this establishment, bring a friend to share different menu items because it's a lot of food.

name: Lee
text: I been there 5 times and I always order the same thing galbi tang. Oh! It was really delicious, dear! Plz try it and you will be love it so much.

name: Spen Ever
text: OmG...the soups are amazing. That's all that I have had so far

name: David R. Gallegos
text: My wife had ordered the 2 Person Dinners To Go and it was good with 4 main entrees, 2 servings of sticky white rice, and 2 side orders, including 2 kinds of Kim Chee (Cucumber and Cabbage) for 2 hungry folks to enjoy...Her Mom was the original Owner +- 20 years ago!!!

name: SeokYong Bae
text: Good taste korean food and cheap price.

name: Jenifer Shaw
text: This is my favorite Korean place in town! The owner is very hard working and generous. He ensures his customers will want to come back. The staff are very pleasant. The food is always hot and tastes great. They have the best sides. I always take family here when they come into town, and recommend it to my friends.

name: Sarah J. Benner
text: Amazing food. My boyfriends favorite. Courteous staff and great food. Plentiful for the price.

name: Neal Johnson
text: If you are looking for authentic Korea in cuisine this is absolutely the place. I spent a year in Korea and it was almost like I never left. The food is excellent and the speed is very fast. The building may not look like much from the outside But don't let that stop you from going in and having some of the best Korean food you've ever had. I ordered so much food that there was no way I could finish it. I will definitely be back again soon!

name: Charlotte Meyer
text:
Everything was delicious! I would highly recommend this location for any lunch time meal. You just walk in and snag a booth or table.

Also, for the prices you really can't beat what you get! For a large bowl of ramen, 8 piece kim bop and banchan, it was only $12 with tax. I had so much ramen left over I had a nearly full container to take home.

name: Greg Brown
text: Good tastee food.

name: Andrew Riley
text: Lovely, sweet and kind people. fantastic and filling home cooked style meals. The atmosphere is relaxing but lively with a hint of charm to it.

name: Nick Hammond
text:
This is some of the best Korean I've had. I frequent here fairly often and am never disappointed. I love the side dishes that come with the main entrees, and the best part is that you get unlimited sides!

The staff is very friendly. Warm and welcoming.

I recommend this place to anyone who loves Korean or wants to try it for the first time.

name: Erica B
text: I always enjoy their food here. Sometimes I think it's a little pricey, but then I see how much I get, and I remember that it's soooo worth it. The staff is so friendly, and although I've learned to order in advance, I always like hanging around to chat a little bit.  I got takeout for my birthday,  this is my glorious plate. So damn good.

name: Brad Mcconnell
text: Good food, good service, cheap lunch prices @ dinner time

name: Cathy Devorce
text: Pretty good food.

name: Daniel potter
text: Top notch Korean food. The best in this town for sure.

name: Amanda Cramer
text: Take out only but food was fabulous. Renovations in the works.

name: Malcolm Hatcher
text: I have been here off and on several times over the years and found that under the new and very friendly owner (family) this place only gets better each time I visit. Under the boss' suggestions I always try something new and never feel disappointed in the selection or service rendered. Truly amazing how they can have such good food for such little cost, and the servings are no joke... make sure you tip well, because you're going to want to come back, again and again. BTW, I ate chicken bulgogi on my last visit and it was awesome. Enjoy

text: Back in town for a conference and just had to eat here. It was just as delicious as I remember!  They are so nice and the food is just fantastic. My friend who had never eaten korean said if all Korean food was that good she would try anything they offered. Don't skip over this place just because it is small. It is worth going out of your way, if you must, to eat here.

name: Brooke Turner
text: I really enjoy coming here for a cozy bite to eat. I love the spicy pork (and everything else). The entire staff is friendly and make you feel welcome.

name: Chase Funk (Zuese)
text: It is so wholesome and good. There dinner for 2 option is a really good variety and value. Their Kimbop is sublime, and I have not found a restaurant that has been able to make Katsu as crispy as theirs. Really good food!

text: Best egg rolls and fried dumplings ever.

text: I’m from Columbus and for whatever reason I’ve never heard of this restaurant...shame on me! It was delicious, friendly service, and just overall awesome. Most definitely coming back.

text: Great place to eat

name: Danny Tejeda
text:
We have been here on several occasions, our most recent visit was 10/11/2019.
On every visit the food was delicious and the service was excellent. There's a good variety of meals and soups to choose from and they offer generous portions. Go early for dinner, the seats fill up fast.

name: Leann Lowe
text: I eat here about two times a week!! I love it and everything on the menu!! 10/10 recommend!

name: Jane Vinzant
text: Awesome food and nice staff!

name: Linda Southard
text: Service was good, food was good as usual.

name: TONYA ROBBA
text: This Restaurant is family owned.  Food is wonderfully prepared.  Great customer service.  Love all their kim-chi.   To me best time to go is lunch. Come hungry leave happy. Overall to me best Korean place to eat.

name: Justin Goelz
text:
Hands down the best Korean food I have had since coming back from Korea 2 years ago. The food was delicious and as authentic as you can get without being in Korea. I ordered the Bi Bim Bap and I scarfed it down and wanted to order a to go plate, it was that good. My wife ordered the beef lunch plate and there was enough food on there that she got full and filled a to go box with enough food for a whole other meal. You will not be disappointed with the food or the service. If you are looking for a fancy place to eat, this is not the place, but what delicious, authentic, hole in the wall that only locals know about, is a fancy place? The prices are awesome! For all our food and drinks with tax, was $21. This is a restaurant we will frequent quite often!

I forgot to take a picture before I threw on the Bi Bim Bap sauce and stirred it up.

name: Dhuck
text: Small restaurant but with good food and good prices everything seems homemade

name: nirra poret
text: We really liked this place a lot! We went with our whole family. My husband and I shared a two person meat special that came beef, spare ribs, chicken, and crispy chicken. I didn't care for the crispy chicken. My favorite was the spare ribs, the grilled chicken, and then the beef. The meal comes with a lot of sides. I didn't know what they all were but one of them was kimchi, one of them was like a sweet potato noodle type thing, one I think was bean sprouts, and one was cucumber. Plus we changed out our steamed rice for fried rice. You won't leave hungry!

name: Caroline Hale
text: This place has the BEST ramen! Their service is pretty fast and I always leave completely satisfied. I’ve tried a few korean restaurants around Columbus, and this one blew them all away. 100% recommended!

name: Bracha W
text: My meal is always delicious and the service is always perfect.  This is my dolsot bibimbap w/ hot bibimbap sauce.  Worth it, worth it, worth it!  <3

name: Donna Hoover
text: The best food at a fair price. VERY casual place.  Locally owned,  the food is always made with fresh ingredients and taste wonderful.

name: Alyse Gurak
text:
I have been a consistent visitor of Korea house for as long as I’ve lived in Columbus (about a year) and have never had a negative experience. The food is solid, the banchan is top tier, and the place is just generally very good. That being said, all of my expectations were exceeded when COVID-19 came to town. This was one of the fastest businesses to adapt, at first by keeping the door open and limited contact take out. Since then they’ve gotten even better, you call in for your food, step up to the door where entry is blocked by a table (with a bell and hand sanitizer) and an acrylic panel at face level, and there is very little contact. It is truly a great place which has stepped up to protect themselves and their customers. I couldn’t recommend them enough.

TLDR: great food, great service, great place.

name: Steven Smith
text: Food and staff was very kind and helpful. Would compare it to a home cooked meal that hits the happy place in you.

name: Vanessa J. Thompson
text: My husband and I loved the chicken Raman I ordered mine without eggs (I don't like them). We ordered the mild but you can order them as spicy as you like. The serving size was great (we had leftovers). The service was great. The sweet tea was good. The cucumbers was amazing. We also ordered a 6 piece Mando. They were really good seasoned very well and crispy. Overall Korea House Restaurant really did impressed us. Thank you. Awesome job.

name: Stacey Ballard
text: So this place probably ranks #2 as far as Korean restaurants go in Columbus. My biggest gripe is that they don't employ enough servers so when it gets busy service is really slack. The food however is good so if you don't mind waiting for a table and slower food arrival during busy times then I recommend trying this place. They have a decent selection of your typical Korean fare, mini plates for the kids, good soups and meats.

name: Lloyd French
text: Very enjoyable! Good lunch menu items at reasonable prices and pleasant attentive staff

name: akira grace
text: Food is absolutely amazing! The server very knowledgeable, patient, and beyond kind. Our first time there so we definitely appreciate. Very authentic with a classy atmosphere. Definitely will return 😁

name: maria daniels
text: Today Korea House was excellent. Our order came out fast and hot and service was good. Much better than our last visit.

name: Nicole Brown
text: Good food. I enjoy eating lunch here. Hadn’t taste anything I didn’t like.

text: Friendly service and great dumplings. Their ramen is spicy even if you get mild the lowest one but I didnt mind it at all.

name: Wanda Santiago
text: Excellent as always! Ever since we discovered The Korea House we have never had a bad experience. Not once! We have to go at least once a month. Love this place.

text: I love the bulbogi beef. The staff is really nice and they serve you fast. Definitely a place to check out when you're looking for lunch or dinner out.

text: Very authentic Korean food that comes in perfect portions Everytime.

text: Food tastes fresh and it is very good. Owner goes out of his way to ensure you have a great meal. We love it here.

name: John Miller
text:
Always great food. If it's your first time, try the fried rice omelette(with your choice of meat) with ketchup if you like ketchup, and the mando (dumplings appetizer).
The initial sides that come with everything are
- cucumbers with vinegar (try it, it's good)
- Kimchi: fermented cabbage. Also spicy
- fish cake. Tastes like teriyaki chicken to me
- sprouts / bean sprouts
Also they have korean/Asian ice cream bars.

name: dr yellow kush
text: was a wonderful experience the food is amazing will go again until everything is tried

name: Jessie Garcia
text: Always a great experience, friendly service and amazing portions

name: jennifer hernandez
text: Service was a little slow, but it was very busy, food was very good, casual dining experience.

name: Roger Gibson
text: The food is always good here. Service always polite. The owners will probably be cooking or one of the servers. I like the atmosphere.

name: George Hagler
text: Excellent Korean cuisine; very homely feeling to the restaurant as well. I love the ramen in particular on colder days; the warm, spicy broth is fantastic. A fair note of warning: if you aren't sure how much spiciness you want, go mild. It's pretty spicy as is, and only gets more intense.

name: Averi Kinney

name: Stephanie Henderson Brown

name: Germy Bunds
text: Great food, prices, and service!  It's a sit down casual restaurant so don't go in trying to get in and out.  This is the type of place you go and hang out for a while and enjoy time with your friends and family.

name: Joshua Vittitow
text: Spicy pork was great, and the goodies brought out tasted fresh! Kim bop and fried Mandu were primo as well.

name: Reynolds Cheney
text: Excellent food served quickly and hot. Reasonable prices and good service.

name: Michael Neal
text: I had the beef bagogi and yaxhimandu. It was good and did not take long to come out. The service was good as were the prices compared to other Korean restaurants in town.

name: Marquetta Gibson

text: Best Korean restaurant around. We've been going here weekly for a few years. Food is always hot and employees/owners are super friendly. Service is quick even when there busy.

text: My favorite place to eat in columbus.

name: Tatyana Boddie
text: Friendly staff and great food. My favorite place to go

name: Joanna Heinreich
text: Good food, fast service, friendly service crowded at lunch

name: abbie mom
text: Food was very good. Speedy service and friendly. This place had quality, quantity and a good price.

name: Clay Siefken
text: Ate here for lunch in October 2012. The food was well-cooked, well-spiced, and very well plated. The meal was filling and delicious and the staff was incredibly courteous and prompt. My first time at a Korean restaurant, I am unfamiliar whether or not it is customary to serve appetizers without plates, but it does seem unhygienic to stick my fork from my mouth right back into a common dish. Aside from that tiny gripe, though... this is a great spot to grab a satisfying, affordable, and quick lunch for three.

name: Lark Lux
text: Great service, authentic Korean food, and reasonably priced. Well done!!

name: K Preyer (Thee Boss)
text: Food is very good.  The right price and very comfortable. ..like home. If you visit during lunch be sure to get there early because the restaurant is small.

name: Mavis Lauofo
text: Food is authentic clean and very nice and personal. Food taste great...the food portion is amazing. If like kimchee... you'll find it fresh here. Their egg rolls is awesome.

name: Frank Williams Frank Williams
text: Food is always great... service is second to none....nice Lil family owned joint

text: Great service and very hospitable. If you're a vegan or vegetarian they won't hesitate to tell you the ingredients of what dish you want to alter.

name: Nitish Rangarajan
text: An unique restaurant in Columbus which serves Korean food. The best were the ramen and the fried shrimp (felt like shouting WOW!) 😋.

text: Ever since the new owners bought it the food is 5 stars the service is 5 stars. This is my family's favorite place to get lunch or dinner.  The lunch plates are plenty and the dinner servings is enough food for two people. Great food Great service. Highly recommend.

text: This is the BEST Korean Restaurant in Columbus!!! Authentic Korean food, and a nice genuine staff.

name: Nguyen Nguyen
text: I love authentic restaurants like this! I ordered the japchae and the fried rice omelette and it was delicious. The rice was so soft and flavorful! My husband ordered the chicken katsu lunch plate and he loved it. It’s a small restaurant that fits 50 people at most, nothing fancy. The lady who served us was nice. Food came out within 10 minutes. It’s cheaper than most Korean places we’ve eaten at and the portions are generous. We will definitely be back whenever we’re in town.

text: Absouletly loved this place! They have amazing Korean food and the people that work here are extremely friendly to newcomers if you are unfamiliar with some of the food they will gladly explain what it is to you if you ask. Definitely would suggest this place to other people.

name: Cindy Moores
text:
EASY vegan option

I called ahead and asked if they had any vegan options. They indicated the bibimbap could be veganized by omitting the egg and using tofu for the flesh. It was SO EASY.

The vegetable quality was good. The tofu was cooked well with a nice, crispy outside. Staff was friendly & helpful. Sauce on side was spicy which I like. The prices were in line for Korean restaurants. The surroundings were pleasant enough/not fancy and clean with ample seating. Service-4 stars, value 3.5 stars, taste 4 stars, speed 4 stars.
Easy to veganize, I will return when in town again!!!

Lady was a bit forgetful about refilling our water but it started getting busy too. Nothing to complain about.

name: Dan Wolf
text: The lady who runs this place is adorable and wonderful. She happily bounced around trying to bring every side dish she could think of with our main courses, and to our surprise we suddenly realized that she was playing the music too on a little electric organ in the corner. She noticed that we had Bibles and played hymns. Then, when our meal was complete, she came over to the table with a guitar and played "You Are My Sunshine"... I'll be coming back!

Several GIs were eating there; probably had served in Korea. The majority of guests were Korean. I would eat there again and probably order a soup dish which I noticed others eating; looked like it was bubbling with lots of steaming vegetables.

text:
(Translated by Google) After a summer trip by the engineers,
It's so delicious that I've been to three times in a row.
Mackerel, fried stir-fry ... Fresher and more delicious than in Korea.
The owners have a similar age, what food skills are so good ...
Doenjang jjigae or Cheonggukjang I wanted to eat, but many guests were Americans, so I couldn't help them ^^

I want to eat again ~ It's too far to go from Korea ^^

In the last summer, I visit Korea House with my Engineer team occasionally.
It's awesome, more delicious than my home country, South Korea.

I miss this restaurant, but It's too far from here, Korea, in Asia ~ ^^

(Original)
작년 여름 엔지니어들 데리고 출장갔다  우연히 들른 후,
너무 맛있어서 연속으로 세번을 다녀온 집.
고등어, 제육볶음... 한국에서 보다 더 싱싱하고 맛있었음.
주인이 비슷한 연배로 뵈던데, 무슨 음식솜씨가 이리 좋은지...
된장찌개 인가 청국장도 먹어보고 싶었는데,  많은 손님들이 미국인들이어서 민폐될까 못시켰음^^

또가서 먹고 싶음~  한국에서 가려면 너무 멀지만 ^^
